英文法規名稱: Regulations Governing Meetings of the Board of Supervisors of the Central Bank of China
中文法規名稱: 中央銀行監事會會議規則
沿革內容:
1. Promulgated in full on June 28, 1935 
2. Renamed and amended on January 22, 1981

法規內容.條文內容: These Regulations are prescribed pursuant to Article 7 of the Central Bank of China Act.

Meetings of the Board of Supervisors (hereinafter referred to as the “Board”) of the Central Bank of China (hereinafter 
referred to as the “Bank”) shall be conducted in accordance with the Regulations unless otherwise regulated by the Central 
Bank of China Act.

Supervisors may attend meetings of the Bank's Board of Directors and may voice their opinions at such meetings but shall 
have no voting rights.
The chairman of the Board shall be elected by and from among the supervisors.

The Board shall convene regular meetings once every three months.
Special meetings may be convened by the chairman of the Board when necessary.
Officers of the Bank may be requested to appear at meetings of the Board.
The quorum for every meeting of the Board shall be more than one half of the total number of the supervisors.

Resolutions of the Board shall be passed by a majority vote of the attending supervisors.  In the case of a deadlock, the 
chairman shall have the final say.  For all Board meetings, minutes shall be taken, signed by the chairman, and kept on file.

The Board may participate in the joint meetings of the Bank’s Board of Directors and Board of Supervisors at the request of 
the Board of Directors.

The Board shall have one secretary, under the direction of the chairman, to handle procedural matters of Board meetings and 
other routine affairs.

These Regulations shall become effective on the date of their passage by the Board.
﹝Remarks：These Regulation’s are made in Chinese which shall prevail in case of any discrepancy between the English 
translation and the Chinese original.﹞
